info.title: Sage Accounting API - Sales Transactions
info.description: Documentation of the Sage Business Cloud Accounting API.

contact.name: Sage Business Cloud Accounting API Team

tags.name: EU Sales Descriptions
tags.description: This is a static endpoint, providing you with consistent eu_sales_description IDs used at the key eu_sales_description_id when manipulating (e.g. invoice-) line items.

tags.name: Sales Credit Notes
tags.description:
This endpoint allows the reading and writing access to customer credit notes that are available in the web frontend at the "Sales" menu item.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Invoicing

tags.name: Sales Estimates
tags.description:
This endpoint allows the reading and writing access to sales estimates, available in the web frontend at the "Sales" menu item.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Invoicing

tags.name: Sales Invoices
tags.description:
This endpoint allows the reading and writing access to outgoing invoices, available in the web frontend at the "Sales" menu item.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Invoicing

tags.name: Sales Quick Entries
tags.description:
This endpoint allows the reading and writing access to quick entries that are available in the web frontend at the "Sales" menu item.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Invoicing

tags.name: Sales Quotes
tags.description:
This endpoint allows the reading and writing access to outgoing quotes, available in the web frontend at the "Sales" menu item.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Invoicing

tags.name: Hosted Artefact Payment Settings
tags.description: For sales invoices it is possible to generate a link that can be used to view this invoice online. By default, this invoice view comes with a payment button, allowing the viewer to use Stripe to pay the invoice. With this endpoint you can disable this button thus payment. To do this, specify the ID of the invoice and "disable_payment: true". It is not possible to specify "disable_payment: false".

parameters.name: show_payments_allocations
parameters.description: Use this to show the artefact's payments and allocations

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Use this to filter by the credit note reference or contact name.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by [contact id](../contacts/#tag/Contacts)

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by [status id](../invoicing-general/#tag/Artefact-Statuses)

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Use this to filter by Sales Credit Notes dates

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Use this to filter by Sales Credit Notes dates

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Sales Credit Notes changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: deleted_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Sales Credit Notes deleted since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Not inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: has_attachments
parameters.description: Use this to filter Sales Credit Notes by whether they have attachments or not

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Sales Credit Notes per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Sales Credit Notes

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Sales Credit Notes (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Order by a given attribute (required) and direction (optional; `asc` or `desc`; defaults to `asc`).
Available attributes are:
created_at, updated_at, date

Example: `sort=created_at` or `sort=created_at:desc`

The default sales ledger account for the contact
Customers only

default_sales_tax_rate.description:
The default sales tax rate for the contact
Customers only

default_purchase_ledger_account.description:
The default purchase ledger account for the contact
Vendors only

tax_number.description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

main_address.description: The main address associated with the contact

main_contact_person.description: The main contact person of the contact.

bank_account_details.description: The account details for the contact's bank account

credit_limit.description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

credit_days.description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

credit_terms.description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

credit_terms_and_conditions.description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

product_sales_price_type.description:
All default product_sales_price_type defaults. Learn more about sales price types
Customers only, not applicable to Start

source_guid.description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

currency.description:
The currency that the contact trades in
not applicable to Start

aux_reference.description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German "Kreditorennummer" and "Debitorennummer".
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

registered_number.description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the "Steuernummer" there (not the "USt-ID").

deletable.description: Indicates whether the contact can be deleted successfully

tax_treatment.description: The tax treatment - indicates which tax rules to apply for a contact

email.description: The email address for the given contact

tax_calculation.description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

auxiliary_account.description:
Auxiliary account - used when auxiliary accounting is enabled in business settings.
Available only in Spain and France

gdpr_obfuscated.description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

system.description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

has_unfinished_recurring_invoices.description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

cis_registered.description:
Identifies a contact as being registered as CIS.
only applicable to UK business

ni_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

is_active.description: Identifies a contact as being active

gb_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Great Britain.

cis_settings.description: The CIS Settings for the contact

destination_vat_blocking.description: Identifies a contact should be blocked due to destination vat

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

ledger_account_group.description: The ledger account group for the account

name.description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

display_name.description: The display name for the ledger account

visible_scopes.description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

included_in_chart.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the ledger account

ledger_account_type.description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

ledger_account_classification.description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

tax_rate.description: The default tax rate for the ledger account

fixed_tax_rate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

visible_in_banking.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the banking area of the application

visible_in_expenses.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the purchases area of the application

visible_in_journals.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the journals area of the application

visible_in_other_payments.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other payments area of the application

visible_in_other_receipts.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other receipts area of the application

visible_in_reporting.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the reporting area of the application

visible_in_sales.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the sales area of the application

balance_details.description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

is_control_account.description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

control_name.description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

display_formatted.description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

tax_recoverable.description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

recoverable_percentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

cis_materials.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

tax_instalment.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for Tax Intalment (Canada only)

cis_labour.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

due_date.description:
The due date of the associated item, e.g. an invoice
This attribute is only part of the response when the GET paremeter `expand_origin=true` is set in the request URL. Even then, it is only available on transaction origins found at the following endpoints: ["/contact_opening_balance", "/purchase_corrective_invoice", "/sales_corrective_invoice", "/purchase_credit_note", "/purchase_invoice", "/purchase_quick_entry", "/sales_credit_note", "/sales_estimate", "/sales_invoice", "/sales_quick_entry", "/sales_quote"]. There are other resources, e.g. bank transfers, bank opening balances, or journals, which--though possibly origins of a transaction--can never have this attribute.

outstanding_amount.description:
The outstanding amount of the associated item, e.g. an invoice
This attribute is only part of the response when the GET paremeter `expand_origin=true` is set in the request URL. Even then, it is only available on transaction origins found at the following endpoints: ["/contact_opening_balance", "/purchase_corrective_invoice", "/sales_corrective_invoice", "/purchase_credit_note", "/purchase_invoice", "/purchase_quick_entry", "/sales_credit_note", "/sales_estimate", "/sales_invoice", "/sales_quick_entry", "/sales_quote"]. There are other resources, e.g. bank transfers, bank opening balances, or journals, which--though possibly origins of a transaction--can never have this attribute.

currency.description:
The currency of the transaction
This attribute is only part of the response when the GET paremeter `expand_origin=true` is set in the request URL. Even then, it is only available on transaction origins found at the following endpoints: ["/contact_opening_balance", "/purchase_corrective_invoice", "/sales_corrective_invoice", "/purchase_credit_note", "/purchase_invoice", "/purchase_quick_entry", "/sales_credit_note", "/sales_estimate", "/sales_invoice", "/sales_quick_entry", "/sales_quote"]. There are other resources, e.g. bank transfers, bank opening balances, or journals, which--though possibly origins of a transaction--can never have this attribute.

status.description:
The status of the associated item, e.g. an invoice
This attribute is only part of the response when the GET paremeter `expand_origin=true` is set in the request URL. Even then, it is only available on transaction origins found at the following endpoints: ["/contact_opening_balance", "/purchase_corrective_invoice", "/sales_corrective_invoice", "/purchase_credit_note", "/purchase_invoice", "/purchase_quick_entry", "/sales_credit_note", "/sales_estimate", "/sales_invoice", "/sales_quick_entry", "/sales_quote"]. There are other resources, e.g. bank transfers, bank opening balances, or journals, which--though possibly origins of a transaction--can never have this attribute.

sent.description:
Indicates whether the associated item, e.g. an invoice, has been sent. This attribute is only present for sales items (not purchase)
This attribute is only part of the response when the GET paremeter `expand_origin=true` is set in the request URL.
